question: In Nature journal's Scientific Reports conference proceedings from 2012, in the article that did not mention plasmons or plasmonics, what nano-compound is studied? Don't use the prefix nano in your answer if there is one.

trajectory.question: In Nature journal's Scientific Reports conference proceedings from 2012, in the article that did not mention plasmons or plasmonics, what nano-compound is studied? Don't use the prefix nano in your answer if there is one.

Advertisement View all journals Search Log in Content Explore content About the journal Publish with us Sign up for alerts RSS feed nature scientific reports conference proceedings article Diamond photonic crystal slab: Leaky modes and modified photoluminescence emission of surface-deposited quantum dots Download PDF Download PDF Conference Proceeding Open access Published: 03 December 2012 Diamond photonic crystal slab: Leaky modes and modified photoluminescence emission of surface-deposited quantum dots Lukáš Ondič 1 , 2 , 3 , Oleg Babchenko 1 , Marián Varga 1 , Alexander Kromka 1 , Jiří Čtyroký 4 & … Ivan Pelant 1 Show authors Scientific Reports volume 2 , Article number: 914 ( 2012 ) Cite this article 54k Accesses 19 Citations 5 Altmetric Metrics details Subjects Materials science Optical physics Optics and photonics Optical spectroscopy Abstract Detailed analysis of a band diagram of a photonic crystal (PhC) slab prepared on a nano-diamond layer is presented. Even though the PhC is structurally imperfect, the existence of leaky modes, determined both theoretically and experimentally in the broad spectral region, implies that an efficient light interaction with a material periodicity occurs in the sample. It is shown that the luminescence emission spectrum of a light source placed directly on the PhC surface can be modified by employing the optical modes of the studied structure. We stress also the impact of intrinsic optical losses of the nan

trajectory.actor_reasoning:
Among the four 2012 Scientific Reports conference proceedings, the only one not about plasmonics is “Diamond photonic crystal slab…,” which studies a nano-diamond layer. Removing the nano prefix, the compound is diamond.

FINAL ANSWER: diamond

messages.name: search_with_content

messages.content:
Among the four 2012 Scientific Reports conference proceedings, the only one not about plasmonics is “Diamond photonic crystal slab…,” which studies a nano-diamond layer. Removing the nano prefix, the compound is diamond.

FINAL ANSWER: diamond
